step1.sentence: Sorry I haven't replied sooner — I have a lot going on at work this week.

step2.story: Maya apologized for missing the team lunch. 'I have a lot going on right now — a deadline, a doctor's appointment, and my sister's visit all in the same week,' she explained. Her colleagues nodded, understanding completely.

step3.story: Daniel stared at his calendar and sighed. Between the project launch, his parents' anniversary dinner, and the apartment move, he definitely had a lot going on. He made a cup of coffee and sat down to prioritize. One thing at a time, he reminded himself — panic wouldn't help. By the end of the hour, he had a clear list and felt surprisingly calm. Having a lot going on was manageable as long as he stayed organized.

meaning.realUsageKo: 현재 처리해야 할 일이나 신경 써야 할 상황이 많다는 뜻으로, 바쁘거나 여러 일에 치여 있을 때 사용한다. 사과나 설명의 맥락에서 자주 쓰인다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'have ~ going on'은 '~이 진행 중이다'라는 구조로, 'a lot'이 목적어로 쓰여 '많은 것들이 진행 중임'을 나타낸다. 현재진행의 느낌을 주는 일상 구어 표현이다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순히 바쁘다는 뜻 외에도, 개인적인 어려움이나 복잡한 상황을 완곡하게 표현할 때도 사용된다. 친근하고 캐주얼한 어조이며, 공식적인 자리보다는 일상 대화에 적합하다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: She seems distracted lately — she has a lot going on at home.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그녀가 요즘 산만해 보여 — 집에서 처리할 일이 많은 것 같아.
